results.title: Manon: a ballet by Kenneth MacMillan
results.creator_credit: Colin Nears, Kenneth MacMillan, BBC-TV and Covent Garden Video Productions
results.brief_description: This beautiful rendition of “Manon” was choreographed and produced by Kenneth MacMillan to the music of Jules Massenet, orchestrated and arranged by Leighton Lucas with the collaboration of Hilda Gaunt and performed by The Royal Ballet (directed by Norman Morrice) at the Royal Opera House, Covent Gardens. Set in 18th century Paris, “Manon” is a tale of mismatched love, manipulation, betrayal, abandonment and death, with Jennifer Penney dancing the role of the beautiful, but amoral, Manon, and Anthony Dowell in the role of Des Grieux, Manon’s besotted lover with David Wall as Lescaut, Manon’s manipulative cousin. Also features dancers Derek Rencher (Monsieur G.M.), Monica Mason (Lescaut’s mistress), David Drew, Gerd Larsen, David Peden, Leslie Edwards and music by the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by Ashley Lawrence. Made for television in association with the British Broadcasting Corporation.

results.title: Manon Lescaut
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Burton, Gotz Friedrich, BBC-TV and Covent Garden Video Productions
results.brief_description: Manon Lescaut, an opera in four acts by Giacomo Puccini after the novel by Abbe Prevost, performed at The Royal Opera House, Covent Garden by The Royal Opera supported by The Royal Opera Chorus and the Orchestra of The Royal Opera House conducted by Giuseppe Sinopoli. This lavish presentation of Puccini’s opera stars two of the world’s leading singers, Kiri te Kanawa as Manon and Placido Domingo in the role of her lover Chevalier Renato Des Grieux. The cast also includes Thomas Allen as Lescaut, Robin Leggate, George Macpherson, Forbes Robinson, Anna Cooper. Sung in Italian with an English translated guide included.

results.title: Mann with a flute
results.brief_description: The haunting melodies of the flute played by Herbie Mann against the changing moods of New York city. Mann discovered that the flute could well carry a melody against a primitive rhythm of drums. His music proved popular, and the flute is now well established in the world of jazz; a world which reflects the influences absorbed from the environment of New York.

results.title: Manhunter [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Michael Mann, Richard Roth and De Laurentiis Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: Based on the Thomas Harris novel “Red Dragon”, “Manhunter” is the first film to feature serial killer and cannibal Hannibal Lecter who was to achieve infamy in the ‘sequel’ to “Manhunter”, “The Silence of the Lambs” (the two films bear no relationship to each other either in terms of cast or creative crew). Mann, whose film work is infused with a highly chic aesthetic, came to prominence in the 1980s with the “designer” detective series, “Miami Vice”. Like the groundbreaking series, “Manhunter” features sophisticated and minimalist production design as well as a glam metallic rock music score. But it also features a dazzling array of truly terrifying and memorable characters who personify the dark forces of evil and cruelty. Brian Cox is a suitably erudite and chilling Hannibal Lecter while Tom Noonan brings a perverse child-like menace in his portrayal of a psychopathic cannibal. Mann’s fast paced direction never allows the pace to drag and the scenario that is unveiled makes for a truly unsettling and horrific movie experience. Cast also includes William Peterson as the hero on the cannibal’s trail.

results.title: Mandela
results.creator_credit: Philip Saville, Dickie Bamber, Channel 4 and TVS
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of the early life and imprisonment of Nelson Mandela, made even more relevant since his release. Twenty five years ago in the bloody aftermath of the Sharpeville massacre, Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela was arrested, tried and sentenced to life imprisonment. His visionary struggle culminated in a worldwide crescendo of protest. A film of many dimensions, it is one of a yearning for justice and freedom not only of black South Africans, but of all peoples fighting injustice worldwide. Starring Danny Glover as Nelson Mandela and Alfre Woodard as Winnie Mandela. Co-starring John Matshikiza, Warren Clarke, Allan Corduner, Nathan Dambuza Mdledle and Julian Glover.

results.title: Mandela
results.brief_description: This film combines striking film segments and photographs with dramatic footage of daily life in black South African townships and riveting interviews with Winnie Mandela to tell the unique story of her life as wife of imprisoned ANC leader Nelson Mandela and the foremost woman activist in the struggle against apartheid in South Africa.
